body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#15236](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/15236.html) (scripts and tools: Make --setup command independent by hebasto)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
I think `==` would be better. To avoid `lxckvm`
diff_hunk:
@@ -161,30 +160,36 @@ def main():
     args.is_bionic = b'bionic' in subprocess.check_output(['lsb_release', '-cs'])
 
     if args.buildsign:
-        args.build=True
-        args.sign=True
-
-    if args.kvm and args.docker:
-        raise Exception('Error: cannot have both kvm and docker')
+        args.build = True
+        args.sign = True
 
     args.sign_prog = 'true' if args.detach_sign else 'gpg --detach-sign'
 
-    # Set enviroment variable USE_LXC or USE_DOCKER, let gitian-builder know that we use lxc or docker
-    if args.docker:
-        os.environ['USE_DOCKER'] = '1'
-    elif not args.kvm:
+    args.lxc = 'lxc' in args.virtualization
+    args.kvm = 'kvm' in args.virtualization
+    args.docker = 'docker' in args.virtualization

body: Just noting that external documentation would have to be updated to reflect this change.

body:
All related documentation which describes this script options is located in the https://github.com/bitcoin-core/docs repository. Therefore, IMO, there is nothing to add to this PR regarding docs.
Or did I miss something?

I'll submit an appropriate PR to the https://github.com/bitcoin-core/docs repository in a timely manner.

body: utACK be88ede292337f40617ccc7f85f591f2a234cc26

The [`gitian-builder/bin/gverify`](https://github.com/devrandom/gitian-builder/blob/master/bin/gverify) script returns the exit code `1` if a signature verification ends with 'BAD SIGNATURE' or 'MISMATCH' by design.

From the Python docs:
- [`subprocess.check_call()`](https://docs.python.org/3.8/library/subprocess.html#subprocess.check_call):
> If the return code was zero then return, otherwise raise CalledProcessError.

- [`subprocess.call()`](https://docs.python.org/3.8/library/subprocess.html#subprocess.call):
>  Wait for command to complete, then return the returncode attribute.

body:
I understand that by this change the return code is ignored, but I'd like to understand why.

If the signatures are bad or the hashes mismatch, the verification should fail.

body:
I mean _script_ fails. You cannot see the result of verifying of the signatures that remain.
With this commit script will not fail and you will see the results for all signatures.

body:
This can be achieved without a breaking change via

```
args.lxc = not args.kvm and not args.docker

body:
Rebased.

@MarcoFalke 
> This can be achieved without a breaking change via
`args.lxc = not args.kvm and not args.docker`

Dropped new `--virtualization` option. So, no breaking changes now.

Also "do not warn about macOS build on setup" feature dropped in favor of  #15236.

Commit messages have been brushed.
PR description updated.

@Sjors 
Would you mind reviewing this PR regarding [your comment](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13623#issuecomment-405684241)?
